result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M. McCuen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lisa M. McCuen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lisa M. McCuen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Lisa M. McCuen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#3 and 21CM227

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa M. McCuen

records.addlTxt: 3:06 PM Defendant Lisa M. McCuen in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Lisa M. McCuen.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. 21CM227 and 22CF151 heard at this time. DA Hatch: guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 21CM227 without the enhancer and guilty to Ct#2-3 in 22CF151. Dismiss Ct#3-4 in 21CM227 and Ct#1 and Ct#4 in 22CF151. 1 year probation on each count/case concurrent: w/ absolute sobriety, AODA, court costs ($443). Atty Nelson and Defendant address sentencing. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 without repeater enhancer in 21CM227 and guilty to Ct#2-3 in 22CF151.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 without repeater enhancer and guilty to Ct#2-3 in 22CF151. Dismiss Ct#3-4 in 21CM227 and Ct#1 and Ct#4 in 22CF151. DA Hatch and Atty Nelson address sentencing. Court orders S/W 1 year probation on Ct#1-2  in 21CM227 and Ct#2-3 in 2CF151; concurrent to each other. court costs ($443),Maintain Absolute Sobriety. AODA and follow through with all recommendations. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days.  1 day credit in each case if probation is revoked. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.  defendant to report to DOC today. 3:24

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:42 pm.

1:33 PM Lisa M. McCuen appeared in Court,  Atty Liesl E. Nelson appeared in court, DA Halle E. Hatch in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF151 (PH) and 21CM227 (STC). Atty Nelson states this is going to be a waiver. Court questions DE. DE wishes to waive the PH. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings. 21CM227 to follow.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif

Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

3:35 PM Defendant Lisa M. McCuen appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Travis Satorius appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NTO, no objection. Court so orders. Waive time limits. DE will need to contact to PD's office to make sure she qualifies. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:45 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
